data.label:
LineNo: 4063735,

Narrator: Serge took a left turn and drove th...
en


Serge took a left turn and drove through the tiny streets of Jen. The city looked surprisingly clean and well-maintained. There was no sign of the destruction the city suffered during one of the heaviest battles of the Civil War.

LineNo: 4063837,

Player: Thank you, Serge.
en


"Thank you, Serge."

LineNo: 4063939,

Narrator: Today was a day of special symbolic...
en


Today was a day of special symbolic importance for Sordland. Every year, on the 14th of March, proud patriots from all ages gathered to celebrate the end of the Sordish Civil War and Tarquin Soll's victory.

LineNo: 4064041,

Narrator: Serge drove us to the city of Jen,...
en


Serge drove us to the city of Jen, the stronghold of Sordish nationalists, for an event organized by the opposition parties to discuss current events. In reality, it was probably a publicity stunt, to show Sordland that the leaders of the Assembly could sit around the same table.

LineNo: 4064149,

Narrator: The National Front Party, which gov...
en


The National Front Party, which governed the city, undoubtedly had the biggest hand in the organization of the meeting. It was not a coincidence that it fell on "Victory Day".

LineNo: 4064257,

Narrator: Jen had survived one of the worst a...
en


Jen had survived one of the worst atrocities of the war, and its Victory Day celebrations were the most jubilant in all of Sordland.

LineNo: 4064359,

Petr Vectern: Wow. That was too comfortable of a...
en


"Wow. That was too comfortable of a drive to have been this fast."

LineNo: 4064477,

Serge Wolkner: Mr. President. Mr. Vice President....
en


"Mr. President. Mr. Vice President. We are about to arrive at the Jen Center of Culture. Ms. Morgna had already arrived and she will be waiting for you."

LineNo: 4064579,

Narrator: Petr was sitting next to me in the...
en


Petr was sitting next to me in the presidential car, skimming through the morning newspaper in silence. Suddenly, Serge rolled down the soundproof window.

LineNo: 4064681,

Narrator: Petr raised his head to look out th...
en


Petr raised his head to look out the window. He folded the newspaper and laid it beside him.

LineNo: 4064783,

Serge Wolkner: I hope the journey was comfortable...
en


"I hope the journey was comfortable, sir."

LineNo: 4064885,

Player: How are you today, Serge?
en


"How are you today, Serge?"

LineNo: 4064987,

Player: See? I wasn't joking. Serge is the...
en


"See? I wasn't joking. Serge is the best."

LineNo: 4065089,

Serge Wolkner: We have a yard now, and the childr...
en


"We have a yard now, and the children have more room to play."

LineNo: 4065191,

Serge Wolkner: It makes me proud to be driving th...
en


"It makes me proud to be driving the two most important men in Sordland on Victory Day."

LineNo: 4065293,

Serge Wolkner: You are embarrassing me, sir. I'm...
en


"You are embarrassing me, sir. I'm no special man. It's the Kadilla."

LineNo: 4065395,

Petr Vectern: Nah, I should ride with you guys m...
en


"Nah, I should ride with you guys more often. I can't believe I could actually read on the go."

LineNo: 4065497,

Petr Vectern: Although I sure wouldn't mind navi...
en


"Although I sure wouldn't mind navigating her dangerous curves one day."

LineNo: 4065599,

Narrator: Petr laughed.
en


Petr laughed.

LineNo: 4065701,

Petr Vectern: No kidding. My driver Sveta can't...
en


"No kidding. My driver Sveta can't hold a candle to him."

LineNo: 4065803,

Petr Vectern: Sure was, Serge.
en


"Sure was, Serge."

LineNo: 4065905,

Petr Vectern: The three most important men are r...
en


"The three most important men are right here in this car, Serge."

LineNo: 4066007,

Petr Vectern: Looks like the NFP mayors have rea...
en


"Looks like the NFP mayors have really transformed the city. Wasn't this an abandoned warehouse for the longest time?"

LineNo: 4066109,

Serge Wolkner: I believe it used to function as a...
en


"I believe it used to function as a rebel militia base during -- and a little while after -- the Civil War."

LineNo: 4066211,

Petr Vectern: Oh, right... The Black Battalion.
en


"Oh, right... The Black Battalion."

LineNo: 4066329,

Player: The Black Battalion?
en


"The Black Battalion?"

LineNo: 4066431,

Player: It's been a while since I've heard...
en


"It's been a while since I've heard that name."

LineNo: 4066533,

Player: Let's not sour the mood with memor...
en


"Let's not sour the mood with memories of the Civil War."

LineNo: 4066635,

Petr Vectern: Sorry. You're right.
en


"Sorry. You're right."

LineNo: 4066737,

Petr Vectern: Sorry to bring it up. May it never...
en


"Sorry to bring it up. May it never be spoken again."

LineNo: 4066839,

Petr Vectern: If you remember, they used places...
en


"If you remember, they used places like this to organize in the '30s. Luckily for us, Soll handled them long ago."

LineNo: 4066941,

Narrator: Serge stopped the car and went outs...
en


Serge stopped the car and went outside to hold our doors.

LineNo: 4067043,

Serge Wolkner: Here we are, sirs. I hope you have...
en


"Here we are, sirs. I hope you have a great day."

LineNo: 4067145,

Narrator: We got out of the car and walked to...
en


We got out of the car and walked towards the entrance of the building. Every spot around us was decorated with the flags of Sordland.

LineNo: 4067253,

Narrator: We slowed down in front of a colorf...
en


We slowed down in front of a colorful plaza overlooking a massive concrete building with a giant sign that read: "Jen Center of Culture."

LineNo: 4067355,

Petr Vectern: Well... Maybe not all of them. The...
en


"Well... Maybe not all of them. Their *democratic* counterparts like the Young Sords lived on, after all..."

LineNo: 4067735,

Petr Vectern: ...Until you finally banned them.
en


"...Until you finally banned them."

LineNo: 4068115,

Narrator: Serge drove us to the city of Jen,...
en


Serge drove us to the city of Jen, the Sordish nationalist stronghold, for an event organized to celebrate Victory Day and commemorate the fallen of the Battle of Jen.

LineNo: 4068223,

Narrator: For the National Front Party, which...
en


For the National Front Party, which governed the city, the day undoubtedly had great meaning. A lot of their supporters could be seen outside waving party flags.

LineNo: 4068331,

Narrator: But today had great symbolic import...
en


But today had great symbolic importance for Sordland as a whole too. Every year, on the 14th of March, proud patriots from all ages gathered to celebrate the end of the Sordish Civil War and Tarquin Soll's victory.

LineNo: 4068433,

Narrator: Jen had survived one of the worst a...
en


Jen had survived one of the worst atrocities of the war, and its Victory Day celebrations were the most jubilant in all of Sordland. Petr and I both decided to attend.

LineNo: 4068813,

Narrator: Originally, only Petr and I were sc...
en


Originally, only Petr and I were scheduled to attend. But after learning about new developments with the Ishval Ersen case, Nia Morgna was invited as well. Representatives from both the PFJP and NFP had told us they wanted to talk about the case in more detail.

LineNo: 4068915,

Narrator: Nia departed Holsord first. Petr an...
en


Nia departed Holsord first. Petr and I left on our own a little later.

LineNo: 4069295,

Narrator: For the National Front Party, which...
en


For the National Front Party, which governed the city, the day undoubtedly had great meaning. Due to the significance of the day and the NFP's lobbying efforts, the celebrations were allowed to take place despite the emergency.

LineNo: 4069403,

Narrator: After bidding our farewells, Kesaro...
en


After bidding our farewells, Kesaro took us outside the building to join the Victory Day event on the plaza.

LineNo: 4069505,

Narrator: Together, we walked up to the cente...
en


Together, we walked up to the center of the plaza.

LineNo: 4069885,

Serge Wolkner: Mr. President. Mr. Vice President....
en


"Mr. President. Mr. Vice President. We are about to arrive at the Jen Center of Culture. We are slightly earlier than estimated."

LineNo: 4086807,

Serge Wolkner: I'm good, sir. In fact, Suzan and...
en


"I'm good, sir. In fact, Suzan and I moved to a new house recently."

LineNo: 4086909,

Petr Vectern: Amazing, Serge. Anton must be trea...
en


"Amazing, Serge. Anton must be treating you *very* well."

LineNo: 4087011,

Serge Wolkner: I'm just fine, sir.
en


"I'm just fine, sir."

LineNo: 4087391,

Serge Wolkner: I'm just fine, sir. Thanks for ask...
en


"I'm just fine, sir. Thanks for asking."
